title: Tense election raises concerns of new Venezuelan exodus to U.S.
content: About a quarter of the population has already fled Nicolás Maduro’s rule. Of those who remain, 1 in 3 say they’ll consider leaving if he is not defeated.
summary: About a quarter of the population has already fled Nicolás Maduro’s rule. Of those who remain, 1 in 3 say they’ll consider leaving if he is not defeated.

title: Israeli right-wing minister visits Temple Mount, showcasing influence
content: Itamar Ben Gvir’s visit to the al-Aqsa Mosque compound came one day after an Israeli delegation landed in Cairo to resume negotiations with Hamas through mediators.
summary: Itamar Ben Gvir’s visit to the al-Aqsa Mosque compound came one day after an Israeli delegation landed in Cairo to resume negotiations with Hamas through mediators.

title: The most unlikely city on Taylor Swift’s Europe tour: Gelsenkirchen
content: This long down-on-its-luck German city is so pleased with its momentary good fortune that it has temporarily declared itself “Swiftkirchen.”
summary: This long down-on-its-luck German city is so pleased with its momentary good fortune that it has temporarily declared itself “Swiftkirchen.”

title: Smoke plumes may reach U.S. as wildfires in Canada erupt
content: One of the biggest eruptions of thick smoke from Canada’s wildfires is beginning to drift south, with the Midwest, Great Lakes and eventually Northeast potentially in its path.
summary: One of the biggest eruptions of thick smoke from Canada’s wildfires is beginning to drift south, with the Midwest, Great Lakes and eventually Northeast potentially in its path.

title: Russian court moves quickly in trial of journalist Evan Gershkovich
content: Meanwhile, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov confirmed talks for a potential exchange deal for the Wall Street Journal reporter.
summary: Meanwhile, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov confirmed talks for a potential exchange deal for the Wall Street Journal reporter.

title: Listeria linked to nondairy products kills 2, sickens 10 in Canada
content: Health Canada recalled 18 plant-based milk products by Silk and Great Value. Danone, which owns Silk, says the 15 recalled products are not distributed outside Canada.
summary: Health Canada recalled 18 plant-based milk products by Silk and Great Value. Danone, which owns Silk, says the 15 recalled products are not distributed outside Canada.

title: Citing poor health, Vietnam leader Nguyen Phu Trong steps back from duties
content: Trong presided over a period of greater economic openness and a domestic political crackdown as Vietnam became a swing state in Asia’s great power games.
summary: Trong presided over a period of greater economic openness and a domestic political crackdown as Vietnam became a swing state in Asia’s great power games.

title: Iran denies plot against Trump, after U.S. reports unspecified threat
content: U.S. intelligence officials have warned that Iran may seek to avenge the 2020 assassination of Iranian commander Qasem Soleimani, which was authorized by Trump.
summary: U.S. intelligence officials have warned that Iran may seek to avenge the 2020 assassination of Iranian commander Qasem Soleimani, which was authorized by Trump.

title: As a trafficker pursued dreams of soccer glory, investigators closed in
content: Sebastian Marset bounced from team to team as he indulged his soccer fantasy, sold tons of cocaine and tried to stay ahead of the law.
summary: Sebastian Marset bounced from team to team as he indulged his soccer fantasy, sold tons of cocaine and tried to stay ahead of the law.

title: A double life: The cocaine kingpin who hid as a professional soccer player
content: A trafficker in Latin America used his wealth to buy professional soccer teams and then fulfilled a boyhood dream: He inserted himself into the starting lineups.
summary: A trafficker in Latin America used his wealth to buy professional soccer teams and then fulfilled a boyhood dream: He inserted himself into the starting lineups.

title: Hezbollah leader threatens new attacks on Israeli towns as tensions rise
content: Hezbollah leader Hasan Nasrallah struck a victorious tone in a speech, claiming Israel has been exhausted by the fighting in Gaza and external pressures.
summary: Hezbollah leader Hasan Nasrallah struck a victorious tone in a speech, claiming Israel has been exhausted by the fighting in Gaza and external pressures.

title: Pentagon ends troubled Gaza pier mission, shifts focus to Israeli port
content: The Gaza pier operation directed by President Biden enabled the delivery of millions of pounds of food but faced near-constant complications.
summary: The Gaza pier operation directed by President Biden enabled the delivery of millions of pounds of food but faced near-constant complications.

title: China suspends nuclear talks with the U.S. over Taiwan arms sales
content: The Chinese announcement comes as U.S. policy on Taiwan hangs in the balance ahead of the November election.
summary: The Chinese announcement comes as U.S. policy on Taiwan hangs in the balance ahead of the November election.

title: King’s Speech and parliamentary pomp mark major power shift in U.K.
content: During the State Opening of Parliament, King Charles wore a heavy crown, and the theatrics of the constitutional monarchy were on full display.
summary: During the State Opening of Parliament, King Charles wore a heavy crown, and the theatrics of the constitutional monarchy were on full display.

title: Paris mayor swims in the Seine, declares it clean for the Olympics
content: “It’s pure happiness,” Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo said, having fulfilled her pledge to clean up the Seine before the Games. Now officials hope it stays that way.
summary: “It’s pure happiness,” Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo said, having fulfilled her pledge to clean up the Seine before the Games. Now officials hope it stays that way.

title: Cyanide, found in cups, probably killed 6 in Bangkok hotel room, officials say
content: Officials suspect the two Americans and four Vietnamese died of poisoning at the Grand Hyatt Erawan Bangkok and may have been involved in a business dispute.
summary: Officials suspect the two Americans and four Vietnamese died of poisoning at the Grand Hyatt Erawan Bangkok and may have been involved in a business dispute.

title: Wall Street Journal fires Hong Kong reporter who headed embattled press club
content: The Hong Kong Journalists Association has been accused in recent weeks by state-run media outlets in Hong Kong and China of destabilizing the city.
summary: The Hong Kong Journalists Association has been accused in recent weeks by state-run media outlets in Hong Kong and China of destabilizing the city.

title: As mobilization rules kick in, some Ukrainian men pay to flee, dodging draft
content: Some Ukrainian men are paying thousands of dollars to dodge the draft by hiring smugglers to escape the country as key provisions of a mobilization law take hold.
summary: Some Ukrainian men are paying thousands of dollars to dodge the draft by hiring smugglers to escape the country as key provisions of a mobilization law take hold.

title: A rarely seen Amazon tribe emerges from rainforest as loggers move in
content: Footage shows the isolated Mashco Piro tribe just miles from where logging companies have been granted concessions in the Peruvian Amazon.
summary: Footage shows the isolated Mashco Piro tribe just miles from where logging companies have been granted concessions in the Peruvian Amazon.

title: Most birds avoid hurricanes. This species chases them, scientists say.
content: A study found that Desertas petrels, rare seabirds that live on a Portuguese island, follow hurricanes for days to search for prey in the Atlantic Ocean.
summary: A study found that Desertas petrels, rare seabirds that live on a Portuguese island, follow hurricanes for days to search for prey in the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Hamas launched ‘systematic’ attack on civilians on Oct. 7, report finds
content: A report by Human Rights Watch concluded Hamas targeted civilians intentionally, committing war crimes such as torture and the use of “human shields.”
summary: A report by Human Rights Watch concluded Hamas targeted civilians intentionally, committing war crimes such as torture and the use of “human shields.”

title: J.D. Vance’s vocal admiration for Orban’s Hungary tells its own story
content: On the eve of the Republican National Convention, consider the party’s transformation into one of the world’s leading illiberal nationalist movements.
summary: On the eve of the Republican National Convention, consider the party’s transformation into one of the world’s leading illiberal nationalist movements.

title: White House touts drop in border crossings to counter GOP crime focus
content: Illegal crossings along U.S.-Mexico border have declined more than 50 percent in the weeks since President Biden used emergency measures to curb asylum access.
summary: Illegal crossings along U.S.-Mexico border have declined more than 50 percent in the weeks since President Biden used emergency measures to curb asylum access.

title: Trump will push for hasty peace in Ukraine if elected, Hungary’s Orban says
content: The Hungarian leader proposed that the E.U. consider changing its policy on the war in Ukraine, in a letter to European Council leadership that echoed Trump’s foreign policy preferences.
summary: The Hungarian leader proposed that the E.U. consider changing its policy on the war in Ukraine, in a letter to European Council leadership that echoed Trump’s foreign policy preferences.

title: 2 Americans among 6 found dead in Bangkok hotel room, officials say
content: An initial investigation indicates they were killed, say police, who found a spread of room service including fully consumed beverages and untouched food.
summary: An initial investigation indicates they were killed, say police, who found a spread of room service including fully consumed beverages and untouched food.
